snippet: Next year, the men’s and women’s semifinals and finals will not be played on back-to-back days at the United States Open.
abstract: George Vecsey Sports of The Times column bids farewell to Super Saturday at the United States Open, which has been the centerpiece of the tennis tournament for nearly three decades; starting in 2013, the Open will try to please stars by scheduling a day of rest between the semifinals and the finals for men and women.
lead_paragraph: Next year, the men’s and women’s semifinals and finals will not be played on back-to-back days at the United States Open.

headline.seo: U.S. Open Tennis Will Scrap the Super Saturday Model
headline.main: Rain and Rest Days Spell the End of Super Saturday
headline.print_headline: Rain and Rest Days Spell the End Of Super Saturday
